subject: Mental Health
title: Warning Signs
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Warning Signs.

hook.text: The first sign of an eating disorder is rarely about weight. It's about withdrawal.

buildup.text: Skipping meals, rigid food rules, and avoiding eating with others are early red flags.

discovery.text: Excessive exercise, body checking, and growing secrecy around food follow.

twist.text: Many people with eating disorders maintain a normal weight, making detection harder.

climax.text: Physical signs include hair loss, fatigue, dizziness, and disrupted menstrual cycles.

punchline.text: You can't see an eating disorder by looking at someone's body.

quiz.question: Why are eating disorders often missed in diagnosis?
options: Many people maintain a normal weight despite having one
